comment: So easy going about assignments, will let u resubmit for higher grade. Will re-explain stuff you don't understand and has been having a TA for years for help as well. Very nice

I did enjoy professor Karimi's class, keep in mind there is alot of work in studio and it can be time consuming. But as long as you work hard you will be fine. She isn't rude or harsh with critiques and she will meet one on one to give feedback for improvements throughtout the semester. Her grading is fair, so take her if you can.

The amount this professor is willing to help you is greatly impacted by how much they like you as a person and student. Very frustrating.
If you are considering her as a DeCom. professor, she knows how to use Rhino to some extent, but she rushes through the presentation and gives no explanations whatsoever. Could not recommend her for this course.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: I took her for Intro to Arch. She is overall okay. She is passionate about architecture which I loved but she was often times unclear about what was due and when it was due. There were a couple pop quizzes throughout the semester. Overall, it wasnt a bad experince, she was okay.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: If she doesnt like you, she will make it clear, whether it be with passive aggressive remarks to her calling you out regularly, even humiliating you.
Would not recommend this professor. She is not easy to please at all and is not afraid to tell you when you suck. (Which is unfortunately often, no matter how hard you work or how late you stay up)
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I honestly had a hard time in this class. She would give lectures on what to do for the assignments but her way of explaining was not clear. I have given my all in the assignments but still, get B's. She is very understanding with deadlines, but will still take points off.

One of my favorite professors I have ever had. She is super sweet and caring and will hold you hand if you tell her you genuinely don't understand. She made such a great effort making our online studio fun and interactive. She was chill about keeping cameras off as long as you're not presenting. As long as you TRY you will pass. DEF TAKE HER!!

She is very nice, easy-going, and will help you if you show that you're trying. She can be a bit disorganized sometimes and her classes could seem a bit boring since all we do is present our work and get feedback, but it is part of the class to prepare you for the reviews. I think she takes points off for absences because she takes attendance.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: she is a good studio teacher. she does give a lot of work but she is very flexible about deadlines. it won't be an easy class but you will pass. and you learn a lot more than some studios.

Prof. Karimi is a caring person who obviously loves what she does and knows lots about it. She is, however, somewhat disorganized. She gives assignments that she does not grade, much like busy work. Final grades feel arbitrary. Even if you do all the work and get a 100 on the midterm and final, you can get a C for too many *excused* absences!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: First year Studio I: she encouraged our class to be creative. We did a few charcoal, pencil, and pen sketches/drawings during class and for homework. There's not much outside of class work assigned, and she gives you plenty of time in class to work on modules. Orthographic, projected, and explosion drawings are assigned. Ask for help and she will!

I loved her class, I took her for both Orientation and Studio and just really loved both classes. She is very helpful, she knows what she is talking about and she expects a lot from you. So if your lazy I wouldn't take her, she will call you out on it and make sure you know how she feels. I would take her again in a heartbeat.

Personally I loved having her as a teacher. If you show that you care and want to do well she will care and help you. She's not very big on design and sometimes would rather you do what she wants than what you want. But she will never tell you what she wants. I was very comfortable around her and loved having her for my first semester

She's a really great person, I dont see how anyone could not like her. It seemed a little too easy though. As long as you put in time for your projects and show that you want to learn...and acknowledge that you don't know everything...you should get an A (:

Mrs. Karimi is an awesome teacher her explanation is very vague sometime however she is a great person who really cares she is willing to help any of her students. She like abstract so as long as your thinking outside the box she will love it.

I don't see how anyone could not love Karimi..  If you're going to be in 1st year studio, take Karimi.  She's a great prof. to have when adjusting to the workload in studio.  She's an amazing person with a great heart..  no complaints from me :)    ****

She is a nice person but she has poor explaining skills. Most of the time your not sure of what is expected. Her comments and suggestions are vague,unclear and confusing. She tends to lean more to the abstract style. Also she does not have a real grading system. It more like how she feel about it as opposed to actually having a checklist.
She is a fun teacher. Take a little of what she says and mix it in with what you want to do and you should do fine. I loved going to her class beucase she was the eye candy for SPSU
